meanings.definition: To lead or move by persuasion or influence.
meanings.sent1: She was inducing her friends to join her for a picnic in the park.
meanings.sent2: The teacher was inducing the students to participate in the class discussion.
meanings.sent3: The magician was inducing the audience to believe in his disappearing act.
meanings.sent4: The motivational speaker was inducing hope in the hearts of the listeners.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of freshly baked cookies was inducing hunger in everyone around.

meanings.definition: To bring about or give rise to.
meanings.sent1: The dark clouds were inducing fear of an approaching storm.
meanings.sent2: The new policy was inducing excitement among the employees.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected plot twist in the movie was inducing laughter in the theater.
meanings.sent4: The melody of the song was inducing nostalgia in the listeners.
meanings.sent5: The bright colors of the painting were inducing joy in the viewers.

meanings.sent1: The loud noise was inducing a headache in the sensitive individual.
meanings.sent2: The cold weather was inducing shivers in the people waiting outside.
meanings.sent3: The comedian was inducing tears of laughter in the audience.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected news was inducing shock in the community.
meanings.sent5: The beautiful scenery was inducing a sense of peace in the travelers.
